zh: 似乎没有人知道真相。

en: It is interesting that no one noticed that mistake.
zh: 有趣的是，没有人注意到那个错误。

en: No one can understand how the accident happened.
zh: 没有人能理解事故是怎么发生的。

en: Everyone was enjoying the journey.
zh: 每个人都很享受这段旅程。

en: Everybody knew her true feelings.
zh: 大家都知道她的真实感受。

en: Everybody knows for a fact that he is still alive.
zh: 大家都确信他还活着。

en: What person does everyone take off his hat to?
zh: 大家都会向什么样的人脱帽致敬？

en: Everybody is calling for sweeping reforms.
zh: 大家都在呼吁进行彻底的改革。

en: Not everyone can be a poet.
zh: 不是每个人都能成为诗人。

en: Everyone is entitled to be moody once in a while.
zh: 每个人都有权偶尔心情不好。

en: Not everybody can be a poet.
zh: 不是每个人都能成为诗人。

en: Everyone was bustling about.
zh: 每个人都在忙忙碌碌。

en: Everybody showed sympathy toward the prisoner.
zh: 大家都对囚犯表示同情。

en: She assumed that everyone would be for the plan.
zh: 她以为大家都会支持这个计划。

en: Everybody expected the musical to be a great hit, but it was far from being a success.
zh: 大家都期望这部音乐剧会大受欢迎，但结果却远非如此。

en: Everybody respects Jeremy because he carries out all his responsibilities.
zh: 每个人都尊重杰里米，因为他履行了他的所有职责。

en: Everyone is an entrepreneur.
zh: 每个人都是企业家。

en: Nobody knows what has become of him.
zh: 没有人知道他怎么样了。

en: No one ever saw such a thing.
zh: 从来没有人见过这样的事情。

en: Whose go is it?
zh: 轮到谁了？

en: Everyone seems to have a bone to pick with someone, but only a few people can be philosophical about it.
zh: 似乎每个人都想找别人的茬，但只有少数人能对此保持哲学的态度。

en: Let no one interfere with me.
zh: 不要让任何人打扰我。

en: Every man has his faults.
zh: 每个人都有缺点。

en: That should be pleasing to anyone.
zh: 那应该会让任何人感到高兴。

en: Who is to blame for the failure?
zh: 谁该为这次失败负责？

en: Who were you talking with?
zh: 你刚才在跟谁说话？

en: You must make an effort to get along with everyone.
zh: 你必须努力和大家相处。

en: Everybody has some good points and bad points.
zh: 每个人都有优点和缺点。

en: It is necessary that everybody obey the law.
zh: 每个人都必须遵守法律。

en: Everyone is more or less interested in art.
zh: 每个人或多或少都对艺术感兴趣。

en: Everyone more or less likes showing off in public.
zh: 每个人或多或少都喜欢在公共场合炫耀。

en: Nobody likes being laughed at.
zh: 没有人喜欢被嘲笑。

en: Everyone has a right to enjoy his liberty, and all the more, his life.
zh: 每个人都有权享受他的自由，更重要的是，他的生命。

en: Everybody seeks happiness.
zh: 每个人都追求幸福。

en: You can invite any person you like.
zh: 你可以邀请你喜欢的任何人。

en: Everyone was more or less interested in the arts.
zh: 每个人或多或少都对艺术感兴趣。

en: Every one wants to live free from care.
zh: 每个人都想无忧无虑地生活。

en: Anybody can make a mistake.
zh: 任何人都会犯错。

en: All are welcome.
zh: 欢迎所有人。

en: Everyone must keep the law.
zh: 每个人都必须遵守法律。

en: It seems that everybody likes golf.
zh: 看来每个人都喜欢高尔夫。

en: No one man could do it.
zh: 没有一个人能做到。

en: Not everybody succeeds in life.
zh: 不是每个人都能在生活中取得成功。

en: Everybody loves music.
zh: 每个人都喜欢音乐。

en: Everybody knows the news.
zh: 每个人都知道这个消息。

en: Everyone and everything moved much faster now than before.
zh: 现在所有的人和事都比以前快得多。

en: Anyone can use this dictionary.
zh: 任何人都可以使用这本词典。

en: Everyone is not honest.
zh: 不是每个人都是诚实的。

en: Give it to whoever needs it.
zh: 把它给任何需要它的人。

en: Everyone is responsible for his own actions.
zh: 每个人都要为自己的行为负责。

en: Not everyone can be a KRS-ONE.
zh: 不是每个人都能成为 KRS-ONE。

en: Everyone of us will have to accept the current of the times.
zh: 我们每个人都必须接受时代的潮流。

en: Everyone makes a mistake at times.
zh: 每个人都会犯错。

en: Everyone remembers the happy days of his youth as his halcyon days.
zh: 每个人都记得他青年时代的快乐时光是他的太平盛世。

en: I want someone to talk to.
zh: 我想找个人聊聊天。

en: Whoever comes, I'll welcome him warmly.
zh: 无论谁来，我都会热情欢迎他。

en: Whoever comes, don't open the door.
zh: 无论谁来，都不要开门。

en: Who invented the telephone?
zh: 谁发明了电话？

en: Who should look after the elderly?
zh: 谁应该照顾老人？

en: There is no telling who will be sent in his place.
zh: 不知道会派谁来代替他。

en: There is no doubt as to who will be elected.
zh: 毫无疑问谁会被选上。

en: Who left the window open?
zh: 谁没关窗户？

en: If you have a bone to pick with a person, tell it to his face instead of saying things behind his back.
zh: 如果你对某人有意见，当面说，不要在背后说。

en: There's somebody here who did it, isn't there?
zh: 这里有人做了这件事，不是吗？

en: Whoever may oppose my plan, I will carry it out nonetheless.
zh: 无论谁反对我的计划，我还是会执行它。

en: Who has taken my handbag?
zh: 谁拿了我的手提包？

en: Do you know who conquered Mt. Everest first?
zh: 你知道谁第一个征服了珠穆朗玛峰吗？

en: No matter who may go, he will be welcomed.
zh: 无论谁去，都会受到欢迎。

en: Somebody's at the porch!
zh: 有人在门廊！

en: Someone is at the door.
zh: 有人在门口。

en: Who cares?
zh: 谁在乎？

en: Who is going to look after our dog?
zh: 谁来照顾我们的狗？

en: Who cared?
zh: 谁在乎？

en: We will settle once for all who is the best.
zh: 我们将一劳永逸地解决谁是最好的。

en: Who is in fault?
zh: 谁的错？

en: To understand someone is to love someone.
zh: 理解某人就是爱某人。

en: You should not cut in when someone else is talking.
zh: 别人说话的时候你不应该插嘴。

en: When you shake hands with somebody, you must look him in the eye.
zh: 你和别人握手的时候，必须看着他的眼睛。

en: I wonder who discovered it.
zh: 我想知道是谁发现了它。

en: Who can put a bell on the cat?
zh: 谁能给猫系铃铛呢？

en: Who will compensate for the loss?
zh: 谁来赔偿损失呢？

en: It is still a mystery who wrote the letter.
zh: 谁写的这封信仍然是个谜。

en: Someone will do that job.
zh: 会有人做那份工作的。

en: Who looks after the children?
zh: 谁照顾孩子们？

en: Who is behind the plot?
zh: 谁是阴谋的幕后黑手？

en: Who painted these pictures?
zh: 谁画的这些画？

en: Whoever may say so, it is wrong.
zh: 无论谁这么说，都是错的。

en: Who wrote this book?
zh: 谁写的这本书？

en: Who has torn the envelope open?
zh: 谁把信封撕开了？

en: Who made the doll?
zh: 谁做的这个娃娃？

en: Who made this plan?
zh: 谁做的这个计划？

en: Somebody, open this door, please.
zh: 请谁来把这门打开。

en: Tell whoever comes that I'm out.
zh: 告诉来的人我出去了。

en: It smells as though someone has been smoking in here.
zh: 闻起来好像有人在这里抽过烟。

en: Someone entered the room.
zh: 有人进了房间。

en: Somebody must care for the patient.
zh: 必须有人照顾病人。

en: He heard someone calling for help.
zh: 他听到有人在呼救。

en: Someone grabbed me from behind.
zh: 有人从后面抓住了我。

en: Someone seems to be calling me.
zh: 好像有人在叫我。

en: Someone hit me on the back.
zh: 有人打了我的背。

en: Somebody took away my bag.
zh: 有人把我的包拿走了。

en: Someone is at the front door.
zh: 有人在前门。

en: Someone is calling you.
zh: 有人在给你打电话。

en: Someone must have taken my umbrella by mistake.
zh: 一定是有人不小心拿走了我的伞。

en: If there is somebody to back me up, the business will be successful.
zh: 如果有人支持我，生意就会成功。

en: If anyone should phone, say I'll be back at one o'clock.
zh: 如果有人打电话来，就说我一点钟回来。

en: Someone has left a bag on the bench.
zh: 有人把一个包落在了长椅上。

en: Somebody is playing the piano.
zh: 有人在弹钢琴。

en: Somebody is playing the piano. It must be Ann.
zh: 有人在弹钢琴。一定是安。

en: They had been dancing for an hour when there was a knock on the door.
zh: 他们跳舞跳了一个小时，这时有人敲门。

en: Someone is battering at the door.
zh: 有人在猛烈地敲门。

en: Someone is tapping at the door.
zh: 有人在轻轻地敲门。

en: He thought someone had put poison in his soup.
zh: 他认为有人在他的汤里下了毒。

en: Someone has torn two pages out of this book.
zh: 有人从这本书里撕掉了两页。

en: Someone tried to poison our dog's food.
zh: 有人试图在我们的狗粮里下毒。

en: Who teaches you French?
zh: 谁教你法语？

en: Someone must have left it there.
zh: 一定是有人把它落在那儿了。

en: I'll arrange for someone to pick you up at your home.
zh: 我会安排人去你家接你。

en: Can somebody get that?
zh: 有人能去接一下吗？

en: Who taught you how to dance?
zh: 谁教你跳舞的？

en: I feel listless and have a throbbing headache.
zh: 我感到没精打采，而且头痛得厉害。

en: The tarantula seized its victim very quickly.
zh: 那只狼蛛很快地抓住了它的猎物。

en: It's duck soup for a girl of easy virtue to find a new man.
zh: 对于一个水性杨花的女孩来说，找个新男人是轻而易举的事。

en: It goes without saying that diligence is the key to success.
zh: 不用说，勤奋是成功的关键。

en: Mr Tamori, may I introduce Mr Sanma Akashiya?
zh: 田森先生，我可以介绍明石家秋刀鱼先生给您认识吗？

en: The telephone is out of order, Mr Tamori.
zh: 田守先生，电话坏了。

en: A sigh fell from her lips.
zh: 她叹了口气。

en: Don't hesitate to ask me any questions.
zh: 请随时问我任何问题。

en: He who hesitates is lost.
zh: 犹豫者败。

en: Without a moment's hesitation, they took drastic action against the conspiracy.
zh: 他们毫不犹豫地对阴谋采取了严厉行动。

en: Choose such friends as will benefit you, they say.
zh: 他们说，要选择对你有益的朋友。

en: Rather than doing any good, the rain did a great deal of harm to the crop.
zh: 这场雨非但没有带来好处，反而对庄稼造成了极大的损害。

en: Any book will do as long as it is instructive.
zh: 只要有教育意义，任何书都可以。

en: I was afraid it would not work out well and sure enough it failed.
zh: 我担心它不会顺利，果然失败了。

en: Try solving the problem.
zh: 试着解决这个问题。

en: Let's take it for a month on trial.
zh: 我们试用一个月。

en: No, don't go yet.
zh: 不，别走。

en: No! After you do your homework, you can watch television.
zh: 不行！做完作业才能看电视。

en: The villagers were displaced by the construction of a dam.
zh: 村民因水坝建设而流离失所。

en: There was a water mill below the dam.
zh: 水坝下面有一个水磨坊。

en: The dam gave way and sent a great flush of water down the valley.
zh: 大坝决堤，大量的水冲向山谷。

en: Pipe down, otherwise you will be hauled out.
zh: 安静点，否则你会被拖出去。

en: Tama sometimes goes for a walk by himself.
zh: 塔玛有时会独自散步。

en: Onions cook more quickly than potatoes.
zh: 洋葱比土豆熟得快。

en: Sometimes her free manner seems rude.
zh: 有时她自由自在的样子显得粗鲁。

en: It's no crime to skip breakfast once in a while.
zh: 偶尔不吃早餐也没什么大不了的。

en: It's no crime to just idle the whole day once in a while.
zh: 偶尔只是闲逛一整天也没什么大不了的。

en: You can't just work all day every day. You need to take a vacation once in a while.
zh: 你不能每天都工作。你需要偶尔休个假。

en: Sometimes it's good for a married couple to go to a hot spring together—just the two of them.
zh: 有时夫妻俩一起去泡温泉是件好事——只有他们两个人。

en: Use your head for a change.
zh: 动动脑子吧。

en: Once in a while, I visit the theater.
zh: 我偶尔会去剧院看看。

en: Why don't you dine out with me for a change?
zh: 要不要换换口味，和我一起出去吃饭？

en: It's okay to take it easy sometimes.
zh: 偶尔放松一下也没关系。

en: You need to enjoy yourself and have fun once in a while.
zh: 你需要享受生活，偶尔找点乐子。

en: How about dining out for a change?
zh: 换个口味，出去吃怎么样？

en: Get out and have good clean fun once in a while.
zh: 出去玩玩，偶尔享受一下健康的乐趣。

en: Let's dine out for a change.
zh: 咱们换换口味，出去吃饭吧。

en: Come and see me once in a while.
zh: 有空来看看我。

en: Once in a while, the prophet indulges in fantasy.
zh: 先知偶尔也会沉迷于幻想。

en: More have repented speech than silence.
zh: 后悔说话的人比后悔沉默的人多。

en: It happened that her husband was a dentist.
zh: 碰巧她丈夫是个牙医。

en: It happened that I was in her room.
zh: 碰巧我当时在她房间里。

en: It happened that I knew her by sight.
zh: 碰巧我见过她，认识她。

en: It so happened that they were not there.
zh: 碰巧他们不在那里。

en: It happened that he was ill.
zh: 碰巧他生病了。

en: It chances that he is off duty today.
zh: 碰巧他今天休息。

en: It happened that he was out.
zh: 碰巧他出去了。

en: It fell out that he could not come in time.
zh: 结果他没能及时赶来。

en: It happened that I met Mr Uno on the street.
zh: 碰巧我在街上遇到了宇野先生。

en: That topic is too intimate to share with casual acquaintances.
zh: 这个话题太私密了，不适合和普通熟人分享。

en: As it happened, I had no money with me.
zh: 碰巧的是，我当时身上没带钱。

en: It happened that we met at the station.
zh: 碰巧我们在车站相遇了。

en: It happened that we were in London.
zh: 碰巧我们当时在伦敦。

en: It happened that I met her in Tokyo.
zh: 碰巧我在东京遇到了她。

en: I chanced to see him in town.
zh: 我偶然在城里看到了他。

en: As it happens, I have left the book at home.
zh: 碰巧的是，我把书落在家里了。

en: He was evidently surprised when he came across me.
zh: 当他偶然遇见我时，显然很惊讶。

en: It so happens that today is my birthday.
zh: 碰巧的是，今天是我生日。

en: Mike happened to have been absent from school.
zh: 麦克碰巧那天没来上学。

en: I had a chance to meet him in Paris.
zh: 我有机会在巴黎见到他。

en: It happened that the train was delayed on account of snow.
zh: 碰巧的是，火车因为下雪而晚点了。

en: It so happened that he was absent from school that day.
zh: 碰巧的是，那天他没来上学。

en: It happened that the day was my birthday.
zh: 碰巧的是，那天是我生日。

en: There happened to be a train accident early that morning.
zh: 碰巧那天早上发生了一起火车事故。

en: It happened that I met her at the station yesterday.
zh: 碰巧的是，我昨天在车站遇见了她。

en: It so happened that I had no money with me.
zh: 碰巧的是，我身上没带钱。

en: It happened that I sat next to her at a meeting.
zh: 碰巧的是，我在一个会议上坐在她旁边。

en: Just take my word for it.
zh: 相信我就对了。

en: You can't make an omelet without breaking eggs.
zh: 不打碎鸡蛋就做不成煎蛋卷。

en: Stop shooting the breeze and get to work!
zh: 别闲聊了，开始工作吧！

en: It is likely to rain tomorrow.
zh: 明天可能会下雨。

en: It is probable that she will come.
zh: 她可能会来。

en: Perhaps she doesn't remember my birthday.
zh: 也许她不记得我的生日了。

en: I should say he is a little angry.
zh: 我觉得他有点生气。

en: Maybe the impulse was working upon her subconscious.
zh: 也许这种冲动正在影响她的潜意识。

en: They'll probably come by car.
zh: 他们可能会开车来。

en: Maybe he will be a good teacher.
zh: 也许他会成为一名好老师。

en: The chances are that he will succeed.
zh: 他很有可能会成功。

en: The chances are that he will win.
zh: 他很有可能会赢。

en: There is a chance that he will pass the exam.
zh: 他有可能会通过考试。

en: He will probably forget to return my book.
zh: 他可能忘了还我的书了。

en: It may be that he will never be famous.
zh: 他可能永远不会出名。

en: Probably he will come soon.
zh: 他可能很快就来。

en: Chances are that he has not heard the news yet.
zh: 他可能还没听到这个消息。

en: It is possible that he may know the fact.
zh: 他有可能知道这件事。

en: It is likely that he has made such a careless mistake.
zh: 他很可能犯了这么粗心的错误。

en: It is probable that he forgot about it.
zh: 他很可能忘记了这件事。

en: He may well be right.
zh: 他很可能就是对的。

en: I guess that would be all right.
zh: 我想那样应该可以。

en: The chances are that the boss will send you to California.
zh: 老板很可能会派你去加州。

en: Possibly, the accident will delay his arrival.
zh: 可能事故会延误他的到达。

en: Possibly the factory will be closed down next week.
zh: 可能下周工厂会倒闭。

en: Perhaps it will rain in the afternoon.
zh: 也许下午会下雨。

en: Doubtless you have heard the news.
zh: 你肯定已经听说这个消息了。

en: The tea leaves all point to a merger, if you ask me.
zh: 依我看，种种迹象表明会合并。

en: It's going to rain.
zh: 要下雨了。

en: Maybe, but I can't catch the drift of even simple situations.
zh: 也许吧，但我连简单的情况都搞不明白。

en: Maybe, but he wants me to stop cold turkey.
zh: 也许吧，但他想让我彻底戒掉。

en: I guess that's just the way the cookie crumbles.
zh: 我想这就是命吧。

en: In all probability, the cabinet will fall.
zh: 很有可能内阁会倒台。

en: In all probability, the money will not be paid.
zh: 很有可能这笔钱不会支付。

en: I dare say you are right.
zh: 我想你是对的。

en: Maybe he has lots of girlfriends.
zh: 可能他有很多女朋友。

en: I should say he won't come.
zh: 我说他不会来的。

en: The chances are that you can pass the test.
zh: 你很有可能通过考试。

en: I've reserved a double.
zh: 我预订了一间双人间。

en: I'd like a double room.
zh: 我想要一间双人间。

en: I'd like a double with a bath.
zh: 我想要一间带浴室的双人间。

en: Double, please.
zh: 双人间，谢谢。

en: You're tough.
zh: 你真强硬。

en: Loose jackets are the latest fad.
zh: 宽松的夹克是最新潮流。

en: I have been there scores of times.
zh: 我去过那里无数次了。

en: You do such a thing once too often and get punished.
zh: 这种事你再三再四地做，就会受到惩罚。

en: Why don't you give up smoking?
zh: 你为什么不戒烟呢？

en: Each package contains a score of cigarettes.
zh: 每包香烟有二十支。

en: I want to get cigarettes.
zh: 我想买香烟。

en: 67% of those who never smoked said they worried about the health effects of passive smoking.
zh: 67%从不吸烟的人表示，他们担心二手烟对健康的影响。

en: I wish I could give up smoking.
zh: 我希望我能戒烟。

en: Put out your cigarette. Smoking's not permitted here.
zh: 把你的烟掐灭。这里禁止吸烟。

en: You must stop smoking.
zh: 你必须停止吸烟。

en: You will live longer if you don't smoke.
zh: 如果你不吸烟，你会活得更长。

en: Don't you smoke?
zh: 你不抽烟吗？

en: I'd rather you didn't smoke so much.
zh: 我宁愿你不要抽这么多烟。

en: Would you mind not smoking?
zh: 请你不要吸烟好吗？

en: Do you mind my smoking?
zh: 你介意我吸烟吗？

en: Smoking is permitted.
zh: 允许吸烟。

en: Do you mind if I smoke?
zh: 你介意我抽烟吗？

en: I don't mind if you smoke.
zh: 我不介意你抽烟。

en: Would you mind if I smoke?
zh: 你介意我抽烟吗？

en: The number of people who smoke is increasing, so cancer will soon be the most common cause of death.
zh: 吸烟的人数正在增加，所以癌症很快就会成为最常见的死亡原因。

en: Stop smoking.
zh: 请戒烟。

en: It is often pointed out that smoking is a danger to health.
zh: 人们常常指出吸烟危害健康。

en: Smoking does you harm.
zh: 吸烟对你有害。

en: It is not good for the health to smoke too much.
zh: 吸烟过多对健康不利。

en: He made a resolve to stop smoking.
zh: 他下决心戒烟。

en: To give up smoking is not easy, but you should for the sake of your health.
zh: 戒烟不容易，但为了你的健康，你应该戒烟。

en: I long for a smoke.
zh: 我渴望来一支烟。

en: You'd better give up smoking.
zh: 你最好戒烟。

en: If George doesn't stop smoking, he will run the risk of developing lung cancer.
zh: 如果乔治不戒烟，他将有患肺癌的风险。

en: Please give up smoking.
zh: 请戒烟。

en: Smokers are asked to occupy the rear seats.
zh: 请吸烟者坐在后排座位。

en: Let me have a cigarette.
zh: 给我一支烟。

en: Smoking does much harm but no good.
zh: 吸烟百害而无一利。

en: For thy sake, tobacco, I would do anything but die.
zh: 为了你，烟草，我什么都愿意做，除了去死。

en: Smoking has affected his health.
zh: 吸烟影响了他的健康。

en: Tobacco acts on the brain.
zh: 烟草作用于大脑。

en: You must not smoke.
zh: 你不能吸烟。

en: Keep in mind that smoking is not good for your health.
zh: 记住吸烟对你的健康不好。

en: The argument that smoking is injurious has become accepted.
zh: 吸烟有害的观点已被接受。

en: Smoking is dangerous to health.
zh: 吸烟危害健康。

en: It goes without saying that smoking is bad for the health.
zh: 不用说，吸烟对健康有害。

en: Smoking is not good for the health.
zh: 吸烟对健康不好。

en: Smoking is bad for your health.
zh: 吸烟对你的健康有害。

en: I don't smoke.
zh: 我不吸烟。

en: I give my pledge that I will quit smoking.
zh: 我保证我会戒烟。

en: He says he will not give up smoking.
zh: 他说他不会放弃吸烟。

en: I prefer cigarettes smoked on the porch.
zh: 我更喜欢在门廊上抽的烟。

en: It's hard to shake the smoking habit.
zh: 戒烟很难。

en: You are requested not to smoke.
zh: 请勿吸烟。

en: Would you mind if I smoked?
zh: 你介意我抽烟吗？

en: You should smoke less.
zh: 你应该少抽烟。

en: Excessive smoking will injure your health.
zh: 过度吸烟会损害你的健康。

en: Would you please put out your cigarette?
zh: 请你把烟熄灭好吗？

en: Cigarette smoke fouls the air in a room.
zh: 香烟烟雾污染房间里的空气。

en: Tobacco smoke is productive of cancer.
zh: 烟草烟雾会致癌。

en: A new tax has been imposed on cigarettes.
zh: 香烟被征收了新税。

en: There is a heavy tax on tobacco.
zh: 烟草税很高。

en: Let this smoky air out of the room and let some fresh air in.
zh: 把这些烟雾从房间里放出去，让一些新鲜空气进来。

en: Sometimes I smoke just to give my hands something to do.
zh: 有时候我抽烟只是为了让我的手有点事做。

en: Every time cigarettes go up in price, many people try to give up smoking.
zh: 每次香烟涨价，很多人都试图戒烟。

en: I was aching for a cigarette.
zh: 我非常想抽根烟。

en: Please forget this, for the love of God.
zh: 看在上帝的份上，请忘记这件事吧。

en: Danny has no sense of beauty.
zh: 丹尼没有审美观。

en: I want to study abroad, even if my parents are against it.
zh: 我想出国留学，即使我的父母反对。

en: I would keep waiting for you if I had to stay awake past midnight.
zh: 如果我必须熬夜到午夜之后，我也会一直等你。

en: I will go even if it rains tomorrow.
zh: 即使明天下雨，我也会去。

en: Even if you are busy, you should keep your promise.
zh: 即使你很忙，你也应该遵守你的承诺。

en: I don't mind even if she doesn't come.
zh: 即使她不来，我也不介意。

en: Even if she comes to see me, tell her I am not at home.
zh: 即使她来看我，也告诉她我不在家。

en: Whatever she says, I don't believe her.
zh: 无论她说什么，我都不相信她。
